Yes, Banff National Park has some of the darkest skies in the world, making it an excellent destination for stargazing. Here are a few places where you can catch some of the best views of the night sky:

1. Lake Minnewanka: this lake is located just outside of Banff and is a popular spot for stargazing due to its clear, dark skies. 2. Jasper National Park: located about 3 hours north of Banff, Jasper National Park is designated as a Dark Sky Preserve, which means it has exceptional quality of starry nights. 3. Mount Norquay: This spot offers stunning views of the Bow Valley with minimal light pollution. 4. Glacier View Lodge: Located in Jasper, this lodge offers stargazing tours and access to a rooftop hot tub with incredible views of the night sky. Note: It's important to remember to protect the night skies by using low-impact lighting, not littering or leaving trash behind, and avoiding campfires in areas not designated for them.
